result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

ADA Walker requests bond condition be modified to state No Violent or Abusive Contact with ERP.  Based upon written request to ADA Walker. Atty Nelson agrees. Court grants request and orders No Violent or Abusive Contact with ERP.

1:02 PM Defendant Joel Thomas Hunt in court.  Attorney Liesl E. Nelson in court for Joel Thomas Hunt.  Attorney Kaley Walker in court for State of Wisconsin. 22CF103, 22CM22, 22CM107 and 22CM108. ADA Walker: reset plea hearing to allow defendant time to get a compass assessment.

on Victim's Petition for Bond Modification: grants the request of the victim to modify the defendant's bond to reflect no contact with E.P. except via phone or mail to discuss their children and house. This does not change the
contact prohibitions regarding the other individuals listed in the bond. The current bond remains until the defendant signs an amended bond and that amended bond is received by the Clerk of Court

on Victim's Petition for bond modification: grants the request of the victim to modify the defendant's bond to remove the condition of no contact with the named victim. This does not change the contact prohibitions regarding the other individuals listed on the bond".
Victim's Petition for Bond Modification. State does not object to this modification  as long as the contact changed to "phone or written only for children and housing".

01:01 PM Defendant Joel Thomas Hunt in court with attorney Liesl E. Nelson appearing via zoom.  Kaley Walker appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 22CF103, 22CM22, 22CM107 and 22CM108 heard at this time. Atty Walker and Atty Nelson: close to a resolution and request a plea hearing. Status conference on June 30, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Information filed with the Court. DE waives further reading of the Information. NG on all Counts. Court confirms address and phone number. Court adjourned at 2:41 pm.
filed by ADA Kaley Walker. eif

2:31 PM Defendant Joel Thomas Hunt appears in Court, Atty Liesl E. Nelson, ADA Kaley Walker appears for the State of Wisconsin. Sgt Denton Anderson. S/T. ADA Walker questions Sgt Anderson. Record reflects identification of DE. Cross Atty Nelson. ADA Walker is requesting the Court find probable cause and bind DE over.  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DE probably committed a felony. Court binds DE over for further proceedings.  Status conference scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Preliminary hearing on June 21, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Def from PCJ

3:05 PM Defendant Joel Thomas Hunt appears in custody from Jail via video, Atty Derek Sanders by phone, ADA Kaley Walker appears for the State of Wisconsin. Victim appears by phone.  Court informs Defendant of charges, and possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Waives reading. Court reviews DE's rights. ADA Walker is requesting a $500.00 w/conditions of NC w/E.R.P., L.J.P. J.T.H. or E.R.H., & Take meds/AS, objection. Court orders bond as requested. Prelim demanded. DE does qualify for PD. Court confirms address and phone number. Court adjourned at 3:19 pm.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
**06/14/22:  At the request of the District Attorney the COC listed to DAR recording of 06/06/22 Initial Appearance.  ADA Walker had requested NC "unless approved by PCDHS".  This was ordered by the court and the 
language in the bond was corrected**  kjf
